intro: Rapunculus patulus, commonly known as the broadleaf cuckoo's beak, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters, featuring hairy stems and alternate, heart-shaped leaves. Its flowers are pale yellow with four petals and are arranged in a raceme, blooming in late spring to early summer. The plant is often found in meadows, woodlands, and along roadsides, and it is known for its rapid growth and ability to thrive in disturbed soils.
